  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: While in transit, a pallet of (UN3265) NALCO DC14 shifted resulting in the caps of (3) Jerricans hitting the pallet/trailer floor and releasing approximately 5-gallons of product. A contractor neutralized the spilled product with Sodium Bicarbonate prior to cleaning up the release. Once the lids were tightened on the (3) Jerricans, they were able to ship on to the intended destination. No storm drains. waterways, or soil were impacted.

  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) one-gallon cans of UN1263 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews downstacked and repalletized the non-impacted pails of product onto a new pallet. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel collected two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, concrete and nearby trench drain and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023110026
item.description:
Report I-2023110026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Univar Solutions Driver went to load a tanker at Associated Asphalt with Caustic Soda 50% at 8:30AM on October 11th. Driver failed to recognize seal on external valve of tanker indicating tanker was filled, and failed to check dome gasket because of visibility. Driver arrived at Associated Asphalt, inputted his load number with specific weights, and popped the dome gasket. Loading then began and once the control arm hit 21,0001bs the tanker began to overfill. Driver hit the stopfill button once he noticed that product was coming over the top, but 25-30 gallons of product was released onto the asphalt. Associated Asphalt workers and driver cleaned up spill with spill pads and sorb-oil. NRC clean up company has been contracted to take care of any leftover product on asphalt ground to prevent any residues flowing to retention pond. No injuries.

  • Description: On October 31, 2023, seven (7) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN1263 impacted impacted dock floor. AS personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pails of product. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-01
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/01/2023, at 0431 hours, personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard discovered SHQX 51000, a residue tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gases, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Maryland Department of the Environment were notified. Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the B-End liquid valve and vapor valve partially open and the secondary closure plugs improperly installed resulting in an active release of lading. The issues were identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Derek Campbell of Kiros Energy, phone 403.483.1250. Contractor personnel closed both open valves and properly installed the secondary closure plugs in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 119 NARRI: 90

  • Description: 1. X-2023101354 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WAS 4 BOTTLES OF RAPICDE. TWO OF PART B AND TWO OF PART A. THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE BOTTLES OF PART B AND DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP APPROXIAMTELY 0.5 (1/2) OF A CUP ENDED UP LEAKING OUT CAUSING THE BOX ITSELF TO GET TORN AND WET AS WELL. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. 2. X-2023101358 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN ON THE BOTTOM SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER SO I COULD SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WERE 4 BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. TWO OF THEM WERE RAPICIDE PART A AND THE OTHER TWO WERE RAPICIDE PART B. ONE OF THAT BOTTLES OF THE PART B SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER BOTTLES AND ONTO THE BOX ITSELD. APPROXIAMTELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT DUE TO THE LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY FASHION.

  • Description: The tank car was seen by UPRR yard personnel to be leaking as it was being moved in the Reisor Yard in Shreveport LA. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson called an emergency response contractor, and they got on site before he did. The car was leaking from a misaligned man way gasket and needed to be replaced.   • City: IRVING

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/20/23 at aproximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 563935 to the station location in Irving, reporting an undeclared hazardous substance shipment. The shipment consists for eight fiberboard boxes, each containing one plastic jerrican labeled "Champignon Liquid" from China. The shipment emitted an odor, warranting further investigation. An online sds of a similar product revealed that the commodity is classifed as UN 3082. The shipment was not prepared in accordanace with IATA Regulations, having shipped without the requires markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The complete shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: On October 27, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon bags of UN3266 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site, HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted impacted loading dock floor. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. The damaged bags and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was damaged in transit due to improper bracing and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor, cardboard box, and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. Granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted trailer floor and worked in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product. The impacted cardboard and all UN2922 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel transferred the UN2920 corrosive liquid from the damaged drum into one (1) new 55-gallon poly drum to be shipped to its next destination. The damaged poly drum was cut up with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum, along with the general cleanup debris.

  • City: HOLBROOK

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was transported to the van line on a cart. When the package handler lifted the box, it slipped out of his grip and fell to the floor. The inner glass cracked, then broke and leaked the acetone out of the bottle. The package handler immediately notified QA who got absorbent materials and mopped up the spilled acetone using rubber gloves and a plastic container for disposal. The box was placed inside a plastic hazmat red container and brought to the hazmat cage for the HESS report to be completed. DescribePack: The hazmat had one of the glass liter containers break. The container had molded reconstituted paper as liners to keep the glass containers safe. However, there was 3 inches of empty space on the top of the container. This left movement for the glass containers to move around inside the fiberboard box. If the box had 1 1/2" foam on the top of the box and 1 1/2 " foam on the bottom of the box, the bottles would have been secure and safer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the inner glass cracked, then broke and leaked the acetone out of the bottle, the package handler immediately notified QA who got absorbent materials and mopped up the spilled acetone using rubber gloves and a plastic container for disposal. The box was placed inside a plastic hazmat red container and brought to the hazmat cage for the HESS report to be completed.

  • Description: On 10/7/2023 at approximately 0330, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved a call from Employee 292350 at the hub facilty in Memphis, reporting an aerosol spill. The shipment consisted of 3 overpacked pallets with multiple dangerous goods shipments that originated in the United Kingdom. The pallets did not clear customs and were set to be returned to the origin location. One of the pallet, ending in -9260 was held due to one of the pacakges falling from under the wrapping. The fallen package sustained damage, due to human error, and is unable to complete transport. The remainder of the pallet is being held, pending the receipt of an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

Release loss estimates are based upon visual observations of the responders.

item.title: Report I-2023080050
item.description:
Report I-2023080050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-22T00:34:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: CONVERSE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023 at approximately 1030am a cargo tank trailer returning a rejected shipment of mixed acids from Gleco Plating started to leak on the shoulder of Loop 1604 in Converse Tx. Emergency responders were notified immediately, and US Ecology Emergency Response crews were dispatched from the US Ecology Cibolo Tx location less than 15 minutes away. The TCEQ and NRC were notified of the spill immediately after emergency response reaction. All lanes of Loop 1604 were closed between FM 78 and Lower Seguin Rd, they were re-opened around midnight once the highway was cleaned up. The Emergency Response crew unloaded waste from the tanker into totes until the tanker stopped leaking at which point it was transferred to the US Ecology Cibolo location to be stored within a bermed area for further unloading. All waste is being disposed of properly at an authorized facility and TX DOT has approved of the remediation at the spill site.

item.title: Report I-2023060175
item.description:
Report I-2023060175

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-18T00:32:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-04
  • City: WESTFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CORRIGAN OIL CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Fuel transport vehicle E/B SR 32 (Main st) approaching the traffic circle at Poplar st. Transport was loaded with 8500 gallons of 87 octane gasoline. Electronic Log showed driver slowed to 19 mph as he was approaching circle. I was advised that a witness had seen the trailer strike the curb on the passenger side as it entered the circle. Driver then starts to accelerate as he was going through the circle to 22 mph. Driver stated that as he went around the circle the tractor and trailer started to roll. Driver stated that tractor went far enough over that he saw the asphalt roadway out the passenger side window. Driver stated that trailer king pin suddenly broke away from trailer and tractor suddenly slammed back down on its wheels. The driver was wearing his seatbelt. The trailer went down on it's passenger side, rolled, and landed back on it's driver side. Compartment #4 had a tear in the outer shell and was leaking from that damage. Product was also coming out of the interstitial holes located on the top of the trailer. Westfield Fire arrived on scene, set up initial containment, and plugged the leaks. Our environmental contractor (3 Pro environmental services) was on scene at 15:56 hrs and also assisted with containment, scene clean up, and remediation. 729 gallons of gasoline was spilled. 3 catch basins in area were affected but we're full of debris so they didn't drain away from scene. All catch basins sucked out and cleaned. 3 PRO Environmental contractor has been working with Indiana Dept. of Environmental Management Dwayne Caldwell (Incident #107392) since arrival on scene on date of incident. Also coordinating with Hamilton County Emergency Management and Westfield Stormwater and associated public services.
